channel.title: Ubuntu
channel.description: I didn't notice this when I installed my version of Ubuntu. I think I installed it twice. I put in the cd, installed it and when the cd ejected I forgot to take it out, and I booted. It then installed again. So, this time I took out the cd. Now here are some pics of my files, eMachines is my windows: [img]http://sagescape.zapto.org/images/1.png[/img][img]http://sagescape.zapto.org/images/2.png[/img][img]http://sagescape.zapto.org/images/3.png[/img][img]http://sagescape.zapto.org/images/4.png[/img]If I did install it twice, is there a way I can partition the space to go on the ubuntu I'm using now?

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Alright, how would I go about doing this? I just stick the cd in my computer, and open gparted, or reboot with the cd and open gparted?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

sageofmali:

SO, the installer CD I used to install Ubuntu, would that be considered live?

Yes, since you have the option to try before installing, it is live.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

boot any linux live cd.
open gparted.
delete all the partitions under the sda4 except sda9 and sda10. (if it’s locked just delete the other swap partitions so you only have one)
right click sda9, resize, have fun

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Arghh, I can’t get to the desktop on either the 161 GB Filesystem nor 158 GB Filesystem, only on my regular file system. One of those 2 have to be my regular. GParted :
EDIT:I am using /dev/sda9. How would I merge the other ext4 partitions into the sda9, ext4?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

sageofmali:

Lmfao, I don’t know which one I’m using. I’m new to Ubuntu. :’(

Place a song on your desktop, and go through both drives (to your desktop) and see where it has appeared.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:

Lmfao, I don’t know which one I’m using. I’m new to Ubuntu. :’(

item.title: Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Figure out which one you are booting into, partition the other one, and use a partition manager to combine the 2.

EDIT - Or just get a live CD partition manager, delete both, format the unallocated space to FAT32 (windows). Pop back in the CD, re-do that partition to EXT (linux), install, and MAKE SURE you pull out the damn CD this time.

Read full topic

It then installed again. So, this time I took out the cd. Now here are some pics of my files, eMachines is my windows:
